intro: Daphniphyllum cavaleriei, commonly known as the Chinese holly, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves that are often glossy and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring, followed by bright red berries that persist through the winter. It is well adapted to cool, moist climates and thrives in partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
